meanings.definition: The quality or state of being effete or worn out.
meanings.sent1: The effetenesses of the old chair were evident in its creaks and cracks.
meanings.sent2: After years of neglect, the garden showed signs of effetenesses with wilted flowers and overgrown weeds.
meanings.sent3: The effetenesses of the tired puppy were clear as it struggled to keep up with the energetic kittens.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant city now bore the effetenesses of economic decline in its empty storefronts and abandoned buildings.
meanings.sent5: The effetenesses of the worn-out shoes were apparent in the peeling soles and frayed laces.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being weak or ineffectual.
meanings.sent1: His effetenesses in the gym were noticeable as he struggled to lift even the lightest weights.
meanings.sent2: The team's defeat highlighted the effetenesses of their strategy and lack of coordination.
meanings.sent3: The effetenesses of the broken umbrella became evident as it flipped inside out at the first gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: Her effetenesses in negotiations led to her being taken advantage of by more assertive business partners.
meanings.sent5: The effetenesses of the old flashlight were revealed when it flickered and died after just a few minutes of use.

meanings.definition: The condition of being exhausted or depleted.
meanings.sent1: The effetenesses of the marathon runner were clear as he crossed the finish line, gasping for breath.
meanings.sent2: The effetenesses of the drained battery were evident in the fading light of the flashlight.
meanings.sent3: The effetenesses of the empty pantry left them with no choice but to order takeout for dinner.
meanings.sent4: Her effetenesses after a long day at work made her collapse on the couch as soon as she got home.
meanings.sent5: The effetenesses of the exhausted hiker were apparent in each slow and labored step along the trail.
